required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Development and Validation of a NIRS-based Sinusitis Screening
clinical_study.official_title: Development and Validation of a NIRS-based Sinusitis Screening

collaborator.agency: Beckman Laser Institute University of California Irvine

brief_summary.textblock: The research at University of California Irvine, Beckman laser institute and Praxis Biosciences Incorporation, develope near-infrared trans-illumination methods. The optical imaging tool that can determine acute sinusitis and the response to treatment therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: In the United States, approximately one in seven people develop sinusitis each year, and 20 million cases of acute bacterial sinusitis become chronic to require medical treatment. The optic light from the illumination wand travelled through the pallet into the sinuses and exited the face. The optic device can determine air-filled and fluid/tissue-filled spaces in the sinus cavity during clinical exam.

arm_group.description: Optic imaging use near-infrared trans-illumination methods

intervention.intervention_name: Optic imaging use near-infrared trans-illumination methods
intervention.description: Optic imaging use near-infrared trans-illumination methods

study_pop.textblock: Study population will be selected from outpatient clinic at Otolaryngology Clinic at the University of California, Irvine Medical Center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female 18 years of age and older
- Subject with normal sinus
- Subject who has been diagnosed and confirm by their physician
Exclusion Criteria:
- Younger than 18 years old
- Pregnant women

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Beckman Laser Institute and Medical Center
responsible_party.investigator_title: Naveen Bhandarkar, M.D., Assistant Clinical Professor, Department Otolaryngology
